com.tinfoil.sms.crypto

Class KeyExchange

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinfoil.sms.crypto.KeyExchange

  • public abstract class KeyExchange
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which operates as a facade to greatly simplify the underlying complexity required to sign and verify keys needed to execute the public key exchange operations. TODO Add support to get the signature for the keys so it can be added to the DB TODO CLEAN THIS CLASS UP!

      Gets the signature from the BASE64 encoded key exchange, which contains the key and signature, and returns the signature encoded as BASE64, for proper storage and transmission in textual form.
      static boolean isKeyExchange(java.lang.String message)
      Attempts to identify if the message received is a key exchange by checking if the message is encoded as Base64, matches the expected length of a key exchange message, and has a valid CRC32 checksum.

      Signs the current user's public key using the apriori information shared between the current user and the number provided.

      Strips the checksum from the byte data for the signed public key used in the key exchange, which includes the additional checksum.

      Facilitate the verification of the key exchange and allow for the user to decide if they wish to ignore the security vulnerability caused by accepting a key exchange initiation from the other contact after initiating a key exchange them self.

      Calculates if the checksum the input has matches the calculated checksum, returns true if the checksum is valid.
      static boolean verify(Number number, java.lang.String signedPubKey)
      Verifies the public key received and verifies that the signature is valid given the apriori information shared between the current user and the number the key has been received from.

    • Method Detail

      • isKeyExchange

        public static boolean isKeyExchange(java.lang.String message)
        Attempts to identify if the message received is a key exchange by checking if the message is encoded as Base64, matches the expected length of a key exchange message, and has a valid CRC32 checksum.

      • encodedPubKey

        public static byte[] encodedPubKey(java.lang.String signedPubKey)
        Gets the public key from the BASE64 encoded key exchange, which contains the key and signature, and returns the public key encoded as BASE64, for proper storage and transmission in textual form.
        Parameters:
        signedPubKey - The signed public key the user received from the number
        Returns:
        The public key received, encoded as BASE64 for storage

      • encodedSignature

        public static byte[] encodedSignature(java.lang.String signedPubKey)
        Gets the signature from the BASE64 encoded key exchange, which contains the key and signature, and returns the signature encoded as BASE64, for proper storage and transmission in textual form.
        Parameters:
        signedPubKey - The signed public key the user received from the number
        Returns:
        The public key received, encoded as BASE64 for storage

      • sign

        public static java.lang.String sign(Number number)
        Signs the current user's public key using the apriori information shared between the current user and the number provided. After signing the public key the CRC32 checksum is calculated and appended to the signed public key. ------------------------------------- | public key | signature | checksum | -------------------------------------
        Parameters:
        number - The number that the key will be exchanged with
        Returns:
        The current user's signed public key based on shared information the user has with the number given.

      • validateKeyExchange

        public static int validateKeyExchange(Number number,
                      java.lang.String signedPubKey)
        Facilitate the verification of the key exchange and allow for the user to decide if they wish to ignore the security vulnerability caused by accepting a key exchange initiation from the other contact after initiating a key exchange them self. (User A sends a key exchange to User B and then receives a key exchange from User B but the key exchange has User B as the initiator) This could lead to a man in the middle attack.
        Parameters:
        number - The contact's Number
        signedPubKey - The signed public key received from the contact
        Returns:
        If it is a valid key exchange the return will be VALID_KEY_EXCHANGE, if the sender was set as the initiator (reversed) the return will be VALID_KEY_REVERSE, otherwise it will return INVALID_KEY_EXCHANGE

      • verify

        public static boolean verify(Number number,
             java.lang.String signedPubKey)
        Verifies the public key received and verifies that the signature is valid given the apriori information shared between the current user and the number the key has been received from.
        Parameters:
        number - The number that the key will be exchanged with
        signedPubKey - The signed public key the user received from the number
        Returns:
        True if the signed public key received is valid TODO possibly throw an exception instead

      • checksum

        private static byte[] checksum(byte[] input)
        Calculates the CRC32 checksum of the input provided.
        Parameters:
        input - The input to calculate the CRC32 checksum for
        Returns:
        The CRC32 checksum

      • stripChecksum

        private static byte[] stripChecksum(byte[] input)
        Strips the checksum from the byte data for the signed public key used in the key exchange, which includes the additional checksum.

      • validChecksum

        private static boolean validChecksum(byte[] input)
        Calculates if the checksum the input has matches the calculated checksum, returns true if the checksum is valid.
        Parameters:
        input - Which includes the checksum to validate
        Returns:
        True if the input has a valid checksum
